info.title: Returns Management
info.description: Buyers can now Initiate Returns from Walmart.com for Marketplace seller items (Except for HAZMAT, OTHER or FREIGHT items). For item in the exception categories: HAZMAT or OTHER, sellers need to generate the return shipping label, and upload the label. For detailed instructions, and to download the Returns API JSON schema, see Returns guide.

get.description: Retrieves the details of return orders for the specified filter criteria.

parameters.name: returnOrderId
parameters.description: Return order identifier of the return order object as part of array. This is the same as RMA number.

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status may be specified to query the returns with specific status.Valid statuses are: INITIATED, DELIVERED, COMPLETED

parameters.name: replacementInfo
parameters.description: Provides additional attributes - replacementCustomerOrderID, returnType, rechargeReason, returnCancellationReason - related to Replacement return order, in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.description: Specifies if the return order is a replacement return or a regular (refund) return. Possible values are REPLACEMENT or REFUND.

parameters.name: returnCreationStartDate
parameters.description: Start Date for querying all return orders that were created after that date. Use one of the following formats, based on UTC, ISO 8601. Date example: '2013-08-16' Timestamp example: '2013-08-16T10:30:15Z'

parameters.name: returnCreationEndDate
parameters.description: Limits the query to the return orders that were created before this returnCreationEndDate. Use one of the following formats, based on ISO 8601, are allowed: UTC date or timestamp. Examples: '2016-08-16T10:30:30.155Z' or '2016-08-16'

parameters.name: returnLastModifiedStartDate
parameters.description: Start Date for querying all return orders that were modified after that date. Use one of the following formats, based on UTC, ISO 8601. Date example: '2013-08-16' Timestamp example: '2013-08-16T10:30:15Z'.In case of dates with timezone, use format '2020-04-17T10:42:41.000+0000' and follow encode '+' with %20

parameters.name: returnLastModifiedEndDate
parameters.description: Limits the query to the return orders that were modified before this date. Use one of the following formats, based on UTC, ISO 8601. Date example: '2013-08-16' Timestamp example: '2013-08-18T10:30:15Z'.In case of dates with timezone, use format '2020-04-18T10:42:41.000+0000' and follow encode '+' with %20

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be larger than 200

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

returnOrders.description: List of returns for the seller.

returnOrderId.description: Return order identifier of the return order. This is the same as RMA number.

returnType.description: Specifies if the return order is a replacement return or a regular (refund) return. Possible values are REPLACEMENT or REFUND.

replacementCustomerOrderId.description: customer order ID of the original return order on which the replacement is created.

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

returnOrderDate.description: Date format for return order date

returnByDate.description: Date format for return by order date

refundMode.description: Determines when the refund was/will be issued to the customer

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

totalRefundAmount.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

returnLineGroups.description: These groups are created per label or type of carrier service required. (e.g., If order has some lines that can be clubbed and mailed together as a smart post then they belong to one return group. If a line is bulky and needs a different type of carrier service, then that line will be part of different group. Customer gets multiple labels depending on how many groups are created for the entire order.)

groupNo.description: Sequence of group numbers where each returnLineGroups will represent one or more return lines

labelImageURL.description: Url to get the return label

carrierId.description: ID of the carrier used for the return

returnExpectedFlag.description: Is customer required to send this item back to return center

items.description: These groups are created per label or type of carrier service required. (e.g., If order has some lines that can be clubbed and mailed together as a smart post then they belong to one return group. If a line is bulky and needs a different type of carrier service, then that line will be part of different group. Customer gets multiple labels depending on how many groups are created for the entire order.)

returnOrderLines.description: A list of order lines in the return order

returnOrderLineNumber.description: The returns order line number for that return

salesOrderLineNumber.description: The sales order line number for the return created

sellerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified Seller; gives Sellers the ability to print their own custom order ID on the return label; limit of 30 characters

returnReason.description: Gives the reason that was selected during the return creation. Reason codes are: ARRIVED_LATE, AUTO_RETURN, BOUGHT_ANOTHER_SIZE_OR_COLOR, BOUGHT_SOMEWHERE_ELSE, DAMAGED, DEFECTIVE, DUPLICATE_ITEM, INADEQUATE_QUALITY, INCORRECT_ITEM, LOST_AFTER_DELIVERY, LOST_IN_TRANSIT, LOWER_PRICE, MISSING_PARTS, NOT_AS_DESCRIBED, NO_LONGER_WANTED, RETURN_TO_SENDER, SHIPPING_BOX_DAMAGED, TRIED_TO_CANCEL and WRONG_SIZE/POOR_FIT

purchaseOrderId.description: The purchase order ID for the return created

purchaseOrderLineNumber.description: The purchase order line number for the return created

rechargeReason.description: reason for recharging the customer for replacement

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item.

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure in the item's weight (e.g., 'POUND' or 'OUNCE')

measurementValue.description: The quantity of the unit of measure for the item

itemWeight.description: Total quantity returned in this return line

item.description: Details of the item to be returned

charges.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

chargePerUnit.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

isDiscount.description: Is this charge a discount, which then needs to be subtracted from the refund

isBillable.description: Should this charge be included in the refund computation

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

excessTax.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

taxPerUnit.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

excessCharge.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

items.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

unitPrice.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

itemReturnSettings.description: Contains name value pairs of calculated charges for the line. Eg: if order line has 3 Qty, this will have a shipping charge = 3 * shipping charge per unit (This is present in the line level charges).

chargeTotals.description: Contains name value pairs of calculated charges for the line. Eg: if order line has 3 Qty, this will have a shipping charge = 3 * shipping charge per unit (This is present in the line level charges).

name.description: Charge Names: lineUnitPrice, lineProductTaxes, lineTotalTaxes, lineRestockingFee, lineShippingFee, lineSubTotal, lineTotal.

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

value.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

items.description: Contains name value pairs of calculated charges for the line. Eg: if order line has 3 Qty, this will have a shipping charge = 3 * shipping charge per unit (This is present in the line level charges).

cancellableQty.description: How much quantity of this order line can be cancelled

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure in the item's weight (e.g., 'POUND' or 'OUNCE')

measurementValue.description: The quantity of the unit of measure for the item

quantity.description: Total quantity returned in this return line

returnExpectedFlag.description: Is customer required to send this item back to return center.

isKeepIt.description: Is customer allowed to keep the product and not required to send it back to return center. This flag is determined by making a call to fraud system.

lastItem.description: This return is the last item on the sales order line and all other sales order line items are already returned. Helps in last penny calculations.

refundedQty.description: The quantity for which customer was refunded

rechargeableQty.description: The quantity for which customer can be charged again for

refundChannel.description: Determines the mode of refund initiation. Valid values are: WALMART_SETTLED_REFUND, SELLER_AUTO_REFUND, SELLER_MANUAL_REFUND, SELLER_SYSTEM_REFUND, and WALMART_TRIGGERED_REFUND.

returnTrackingDetail.description: Informational blocks added as the return order completes its journey from return creation to received and refunded.

sequenceNo.description: The stage the return is in. (e.g., '1' is an initiated return)

eventDescription.description: Description of current return status event. (e.g., 'A MARKET_PLACE Return in Transit')

items.description: Informational blocks added as the return order completes its journey from return creation to received and refunded.

currentDeliveryStatus.description: Determines the current carrier tracking status of the return.

currentRefundStatus.description: Determines the current refund status of the return.

items.description: A list of order lines in the return order

channelName.description: Valid values are: ONLINE, IN_STORE, and CUSTOMER_CARE

returnChannel.description: The channel via order return got initiated

items.description: List of returns for the seller.

item.productName: Antlion Audio ModMic Wireless Attachable Boom Microphone

post.description:
This API allows sellers to issue refund against a return order. Multiple return order lines can be refunded in one request.

Note: Sellers can use the Refund Order Lines API for all non-exception category items, including adjustments that seller needs to determine a partial refund amount. Especially for exception category items: HAZMAT, OTHER and FREIGHT that are not eligible for the Marketplace Returns Program.

parameters.name: returnOrderId
parameters.description: The return order ID

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

returnOrderLineNumber.description: A line number associated with each individual line in the return order. If return order has only one return order line and it is not provided in the request, the only available return order line is auto-selected. If return order has multiple return order lines, the required return order line must be provided in the request. If not provided in the request, it will result in data-error.

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

returnOrderLineNumber.description: A line number associated with each individual line in the return order. If return order has only one return order line and it is not provided in the request, the only available return order line is auto-selected. If return order has multiple return order lines, the required return order line must be provided in the request. If not provided in the request, it will result in data-error.

post.description:
Sellers can specify global settings for returns in Seller Center, and they can override individual item level settings using this API.

Empty values for the settings will remove the existing overriden values and revert them to global settings.

For more details, see the announcement for[Bulk Return Rules](https://sellerhelp.walmart.com/s/guide?article=000008197).

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure in the item's weight (e.g., 'POUND' or 'OUNCE')

measurementValue.description: The quantity of the unit of measure for the item

quantity.description: Total quantity returned in this return line

returnExpectedFlag.description: Is customer required to send this item back to return center.

isKeepIt.description: Is customer allowed to keep the product and not required to send it back to return center. This flag is determined by making a call to fraud system.

lastItem.description: This return is the last item on the sales order line and all other sales order line items are already returned. Helps in last penny calculations.

refundedQty.description: The quantity for which customer was refunded

rechargeableQty.description: The quantity for which customer can be charged again for

refundChannel.description: Determines the mode of refund initiation. Valid values are: WALMART_SETTLED_REFUND, SELLER_AUTO_REFUND, SELLER_MANUAL_REFUND, SELLER_SYSTEM_REFUND, and WALMART_TRIGGERED_REFUND.

returnTrackingDetail.description: Informational blocks added as the return order completes its journey from return creation to received and refunded.

sequenceNo.description: The stage the return is in. (e.g., '1' is an initiated return)

eventDescription.description: Description of current return status event. (e.g., 'A MARKET_PLACE Return in Transit')

items.description: Informational blocks added as the return order completes its journey from return creation to received and refunded.

currentDeliveryStatus.description: Determines the current carrier tracking status of the return.

currentRefundStatus.description: Determines the current refund status of the return.

items.description: A list of order lines in the return order

channelName.description: Valid values are: ONLINE, IN_STORE, and CUSTOMER_CARE

returnChannel.description: The channel via order return got initiated

ReturnOrder.description: List of returns for the seller.

returnOrderLineNumber.description: The returns order line number for that return

salesOrderLineNumber.description: The sales order line number for the return created

sellerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified Seller; gives Sellers the ability to print their own custom order ID on the return label; limit of 30 characters

returnReason.description: Gives the reason that was selected during the return creation. Reason codes are: ARRIVED_LATE, AUTO_RETURN, BOUGHT_ANOTHER_SIZE_OR_COLOR, BOUGHT_SOMEWHERE_ELSE, DAMAGED, DEFECTIVE, DUPLICATE_ITEM, INADEQUATE_QUALITY, INCORRECT_ITEM, LOST_AFTER_DELIVERY, LOST_IN_TRANSIT, LOWER_PRICE, MISSING_PARTS, NOT_AS_DESCRIBED, NO_LONGER_WANTED, RETURN_TO_SENDER, SHIPPING_BOX_DAMAGED, TRIED_TO_CANCEL and WRONG_SIZE/POOR_FIT

purchaseOrderId.description: The purchase order ID for the return created

purchaseOrderLineNumber.description: The purchase order line number for the return created

rechargeReason.description: reason for recharging the customer for replacement

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item.

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure in the item's weight (e.g., 'POUND' or 'OUNCE')

measurementValue.description: The quantity of the unit of measure for the item

itemWeight.description: Total quantity returned in this return line

item.description: Details of the item to be returned

charges.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

chargePerUnit.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

isDiscount.description: Is this charge a discount, which then needs to be subtracted from the refund

isBillable.description: Should this charge be included in the refund computation

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

excessTax.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

taxPerUnit.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

excessCharge.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

unitPrice.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

chargeTotals.description: Contains name value pairs of calculated charges for the line. Eg: if order line has 3 Qty, this will have a shipping charge = 3 * shipping charge per unit (This is present in the line level charges).

name.description: Charge Names: lineUnitPrice, lineProductTaxes, lineTotalTaxes, lineRestockingFee, lineShippingFee, lineSubTotal, lineTotal.

value.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

eventDescription.description: Description of current return status event. (e.g., 'A MARKET_PLACE Return in Transit')

ReturnOrderLine.description: A list of order lines in the return order

sequenceNo.description: The stage the return is in. (e.g., '1' is an initiated return)

eventDescription.description: Description of current return status event. (e.g., 'A MARKET_PLACE Return in Transit')

ReturnTrackingDetail.description: Informational blocks added as the return order completes its journey from return creation to received and refunded.

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

excessTax.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

currencyAmount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

taxPerUnit.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

returnOrderLineNumber.description: A line number associated with each individual line in the return order. If return order has only one return order line and it is not provided in the request, the only available return order line is auto-selected. If return order has multiple return order lines, the required return order line must be provided in the request. If not provided in the request, it will result in data-error.

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

returnOrderLineNumber.description: A line number associated with each individual line in the return order. If return order has only one return order line and it is not provided in the request, the only available return order line is auto-selected. If return order has multiple return order lines, the required return order line must be provided in the request. If not provided in the request, it will result in data-error.

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

returnOrderLineNumber.description: A line number associated with each individual line in the return order. If return order has only one return order line and it is not provided in the request, the only available return order line is auto-selected. If return order has multiple return order lines, the required return order line must be provided in the request. If not provided in the request, it will result in data-error.

feedId.description: A unique ID, returned from the Bulk Upload API, used for tracking the Feed File.

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID
